main.docTitle: Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Electrolytic Chromium Process) Regulations

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Electrolytic Chromium Process) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: electrolytic chromium process (電解鉻工序) means the electrolytic plating, polishing or oxidation of articles wholly or partly consisting of metal by the use of an electrolyte containing chromic acid or other chromium compound;
employee (僱員) means a person employed in any process involving contact with liquid or vapour from a bath.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.content: These regulations shall apply to any industrial undertaking in which any electrolytic chromium process is carried on.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Floors
section.content: The floor of every place containing a bath shall be rendered even and impervious to water and shall be maintained in that condition and washed down daily.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Mechanical exhaust
section.content: At every bath in which an electrolytic chromium process is carried on, an efficient exhaust draught shall be provided by mechanical means and shall operate on the vapour or spray given off as near as may be at the point of origin, so as to prevent it from entering into any other place in which any person works.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Provision, storage and drying of protective clothing

subsection.leadIn: There shall be provided and maintained in good condition for the use of every employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: aprons with bibs, which shall be of sufficient length and made of rubber, leather or other impermeable material;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: loose fitting rubber gloves of suitable length; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: rubber boots or other waterproof foot wear.

subsection.content: There shall be provided and maintained in good condition suitable accommodation for the storage, and adequate arrangement for the drying, of the protective clothing provided under paragraph (1).

subsection.leadIn: There shall be provided for the use of every employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sufficient supply of clean towels, which shall be renewed daily; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a sufficient supply of water, soap, nail brushes and ointments suitable for the protection of the skin.

subsection.def: In this regulation, employee (僱員) includes a person engaged in subsequent polishing or finishing by aid of mechanical power involving exposure to chromium oxide or other compounds of chromium.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Warning notice
section.content: A notice, in English and Chinese, as to the effects of chrome on the skin, and in a form approved by the Commissioner shall be prominently displayed adjacent to every bath.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Misuse of appliance, protective clothing
section.content: No employee shall misuse or, without the consent of the proprietor, interfere with any appliance or any item of protective clothing provided in accordance with these regulations.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Persons employed to wear protective clothing

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wear the protective clothing provided for him under regulation 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when it is not being worn, deposit the protective clothing provided for him, in the place for the storage thereof provided under regulation 6.

subsection.leadIn: A proprietor of an industrial undertaking who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes regulation 4, 7 or 8 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes regulation 5 or 6 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

subsection.content: An employee who contravenes regulation 9 or 10 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.
